column2: NEW YORK DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column8: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column10: there is a school zone after the curve.

column2: 2. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
column8: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.

column2: 3. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column8: exceed the speed limit

column2: 4. Driving with tires that have cuts down to the cords or bumps:
column8: is only allowed on interstate highways.

column2: 5. For a second Zero Tolerance violation, the driver license will be:
column4: be revoked for at least 18 months or until the driver reaches 18, whichever is longer.
column6: revoked for at least two years.
column8: revoked for at least one year or until the driver reaches 21, whichever is longer.

column2: 6. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: left and right turns are not allowed.
column8: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 7. The speed limit on an expressway is normally:
column8: 65 MPH

column2: 8. Never make a U-turn from:
column6: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
column8: the lane youâ€™re in.

column2: 9. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column6: quickly change speed or lane position.
column8: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.

column2: 10. After you have parallel parked, how near to the curb must your vehicle be?
column8: 2 feet.

column2: 11. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column8: Stop sign

column2: 12. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column6: The use of headlight is required by law.
column8: Reduced visibility.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column6: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column10: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.

column2: 14. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column6: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column8: there is a right turn ahead.

column2: 15. Vehicles must be inspected for maintenance and safety:
column8: not less than 3 times a year.

column2: 16. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column6: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

column2: 17. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: move to another lane if possible.
column6: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column8: brake suddenly.

column2: 18. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As close as possible to the center line.
column8: As far to the right as possible.

column2: 19. This signal means:
column8: Stop

column2: 20. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column8: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
